bibl.title: Letter from Frederick F. Russell to S.S. Goldwater, April 9, 1935

div1.p: Russell recommends Truby for a hospital position, describing his character and experience.

div1.head: Letter from Frederick F. Russell to S.S. Goldwater, April 9, 1935

opener.dateline:
THE ROCKEFELLER FOUNDATION
INTERNATIONAL HEALTH DIVISION
Frederick F. Russell, M.D., Director
49 West 49th Street, New York
Cable Address: Rockfound, New York.
April 9, 1935.

div1.p:
An old colleague of mine, Dr. A. E. Truby, who is a Brigadier General
of the Medical Corps of the United States Army, came in to see me to tell
me of his interview with you and the interest that you are taking in filling
a position for which you have been considering him.

I have known Dr. Truby for many years and we worked together in Ancon,
Panama, and at the Walter Reed Hospital in Washington. While we were in
Panama Truby rebuilt the Ancon Hospital, which is now called the Gorgas Hos-
pital, and we worked together on the project a good deal. From my knowledge
of him over these many years, I can say without any reservation whatsoever
that he is one of the best medical administrators I have ever known and he
has a way of accomplishing results without arousing resistance or antagonism.
He is a man of few words and of very good judgment and in all the years I
have known him it has always seemed to me that his judgment in any new situa-
tion was much better than any one else on the various boards of which he and
I have been members. He is quiet, non-controversial, but has a way of get-
ting things done and of gaining the respect of his colleagues and assistants.
The present excellent state of the Army Medical Center in Washington is to my
mind due more to the excellent management of Truby than to anything else.
He is in excellent health and his general appearance gives one the impression
of robustness.

If you care to ask any questions about him, I shall be very glad indeed
to answer them.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, (Sgd.) F. F. Russell
Brigadier General, M.O.R.C.
U.S. Army Dr. S. S. Goldwater
Municipal Building
139 Centre Street
New York City
